name: tvdb_api
description: Simple to use TVDB (thetvdb.com) API in Python, and automatic TV episode namer

commit.message: Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/dbr/tvdb_api
Fixed error introduced with retrieving mode tvdb data changes

Now retrive all episode data from thetvdb into Episode() instance. Important change to API: to get the episode name, you now request the attribute ['episodename'] instead of ['name'] (this has been updated in tvnamer, and all the docstrings in previous commits)
Names are now retrived as unicode (from BeautifulSoup) instead of being str()'d
Modified tests to use new ['episodename'] attribute, not the old ['name']. Also added test for checking additional data being retrived
Updated docstrings to use t['Scrubs'][1][24]['episodename'] in examples (instead of ['name'])
Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/dbr/tvdb_api
test
Fixed searching when a numeric key or string was supplied
Each t['show'][1][2] instance now has a ['seasonnumber'] and ['episode'] element, and no longer always has ['name'] set to None if no name is found
Fixed up docstring examples, and added a doctstring test (everything currently passing)
Removed now unused _Ddict class (it was replaced with the ShowContainer/Shows/Seasons/Episode classes)
Added test for search
Can now search by doing t=Tvdb(); t['Scrubs'].search('my first', key='name') and get an array of matching Episode() instances
Bumped to v0.3 in preperation for first proper release (v0.2 was put on PyPi mostly as a test, v0.1 was the time before I considered releasing it properly).
Added classifiers to setup.py, stopped it putting the tvdb_api.py script in $PATH
Merge branch 'master' into egg
tvnamer.py now exits with exit-code 2 if no files are found, and consistently with exit-code 1 when the user aborts the command
If the debug flag is used, it now shows the regex match information
Commented break statement in processNames, whitespace after file-showname cleanup
Moved extension-dot stripping to processNames so the extension never has that dot anywhere in the script
Stray debugging message
Fixed bug with script not knowing the orginal filename so was unable to rename the file.
Fixed a few sytnax problems (trying to call exit() from os), added a docstring to the unittests setUp call, made all the aborts use sys.exit(1) instead of one using break, removed redundant line
Merge branch 'master' into egg
Fixed a few sytnax problems (trying to call exit() from os), added a docstring to the unittests setUp call, made all the aborts use sys.exit(1) instead of one using break
Made the regex-tests only run on numbers 0-10 (running 0-99 was rather redundant, and didn't prove anything, and took about 30 seconds extra to run..)

Fixed parsing of "123 2008 - 0203.avi" (ugh) and such formats, where it was treating the show name year as the episode/season number (made regex for showname greedy, so it found the last set of matching numbers, and also made them the lowest priority  regexs)
Handle incorrect input into the "Rename? y/n/a/q" prompt by allowing the user to reenter
Using the new exceptions to better handle show/episode/name not found sitations, far cleaner!
Import new exceptions
Improved tests and test-docstrings, and the cleaned up the main() methods
Linked in methods-calls to use new data abstraction classes
Methods to set a showname, or data for a show (currently used to store the corrected showname)

Working abstraction of show-data! It's basically a one-way series of dicts, which raise the approriate execptions if a show/season/episode cannot be found. To set data, you have to check if show.has_key(show_id), if not, create a new Season() instance, then if show[show_id].has_key(season_number), if not, create a new Season() instance and so on.
Few changes to exceptions
Better set of exceptions, show/season/episode/attribute not found, tests to check them
Better set of exceptions, show/season/episode/attribute not found, tests to check them
Okay this method isn't any better than the _Ddict one, when dealing with shows[1][12]['name'] = "blah" we can't check if that season exists (and raise seasonnotfound), but I have a cunning plan
Merge branch 'master' into egg
Merge branch 'master' into abstractdata

Added more name formats to the test, also removed a lot of redundancy in the unittests (the actual testing has moved to _run_test() and each test_ just defines the input showname), the test also now checks every season/episode from season 1 - 99 and episode 1 - 99
Commented what the self.verbose line dones
Renamed name parser unittest in preperation for testing more parts of tvnamer
Cleaning up the new regex, also uses valid_filename_chars for the showname instead of black-listing a few characters Windows doesn't like
The more abrupt os._exit() doesn't seem nessecary now for some reason, good
Removed redundant .strip()
Cleaning up "abc=[]" lines to "abc = []"
Removed debug print statement
Merge branch 'master' into egg
Merge branch 'master' into abstractdata
Fixed regex to allow suport for all valid windows filename characters.
Added support for more file name formats.
Inital abstraction of show-data into classes (currently acts just like dict-of-dicts)
Bumped version to 0.2 for inital PyPi release
Added inital setup.py script
Made headers match tvdb_api (split up license line)
Use Tvdb, not tvdb
Renamed tvdb class to Tvdb
Now uses random mirror from thetvdb.com mirror list (Issue #1)
Small comment fix
Removed sys module from __main__ function
Implimented cache expiration (Issue #2)
Made tvnamer and tvdb_api a bit more PEP8'ish (cleaned up syntax, PyLint score went from about 4 to about 7). Also improved tvdb_api tests, and moved the tests from tvnamer.py to tvdb_api.py
Removed debugging print statement from tests

Quick fix for error where if any show missed an single episode, tvdb_api would not store any of the remaining episode names (tvdb_epnamenotfound was raise'd in the completely wrong place, it now sets the episode name to None - in the future tvdb_api may retrive other info the episode may have, so skipping that episode completely isn't the best solution) (Thanks Jono for reporting this bug)
Cleaning up log.debug() lines
Adding more docstrings, cleaning up existing ones
Tried to rename the file regardless of if the tvdb_shownotfound exception was raised, because finally: was used (always run) instead of else:
Cleaned up formatName( cfile) to formatName(cfile), added "done" message in output
Doc-strings on Cache class
Improved user-input handling. Deals with 'q' quit command and interupts (^c) much cleaner

Fixed bug where if you passed tvnamer a full path to a file, when renaming it would move the file to the current dir (Because it done rename(old_file_path,new_file_name), not rename(old_file_path,new_file_path)
Added Creative Commons GNU GPL v2 license, made sure shbang/encoding/author/other-headers were in all files
Hugely improved unittests, now runs the tests on same filename formats, but with different shownames (alpha-only, alpha-and-hyphens, numberic-only)
Added verbose argument to processNames (shows the filename, what regex matched it, and the segments it grabbed)
Regex fix
Now using exception for "showname not found" error
Added an exception for "episode name not found", instead of returning "None"
Fixed unicode error that occured when a showname was listed with unicode characters
Fixed "always rename" option (which broke after optparse option was added for --always)
Improved console GUI (made episode-name not found error clearer, season/episode numbers were flipped in "Processing showname (season: 1, episode 2)" info)
Added more dockstrings and commits
Added _cleanName function which replaces URL-encoded & with "and"
Linked in cache module (removed unneeded urllib import)
Added basic Cache class to tvdb_api
Fixed a stupid UI flaw - it now shows the show/season number/episode number before making the user select the correct show
Removed unused interactive flag from _getSeries function
Space disappeared from list of valid characters, more regex fixing and another filename format added (show.name.1x20.blah.avi)
Implimented -t (unittest) flag, now no-longer have to uncomment unittest.main() to run tests
Valid filename characters now stored in triple-quoted string
Added git-ignore
Added unittest flag
Deal with unicode corrected-showname by converting unticode to ASCII
Moved cfile['showname'] (parsed showname from filename) to cfile['file_showname'] to deal with corrected showname from tvdb. Also now deals with tvdb_shownotfound exception
Numerous fixes to filename parsing regexs, added unittests for both tvdb and filename parsing
Can now get corrected showname by doing tvdb_instance['my.Show.nAme']['showname'] (Will return "My Show Name")
Improved --help output, vaious fixes to --always and --interactive handling
No valid files found error didn't have trailing \n
Debug to file went to stderr and vice-versa
Added (semi-)automated TV episode namer. Works, but needs clean-up and more testing
Fixed debugging option-name in code, added doc-string and a few other fixes
Added version/author to class
Added first (sort of) public version

name: calendar_date_select
description: A popular and flexible JavaScript DatePicker for RubyOnRails (and others)
readme:
::CalendarDateSelect::
Author:   Tim Harper ( 'tim_see_harperATgmail._see_om'.gsub('_see_', 'c').gsub('AT', '@') )

::Examples::
see demo here -- http://restatesman.com/static/calendar

::Project Site::
http://code.google.com/p/calendardateselect/

It works!



Setup for "vendored gem":
In enviroment.rb add the gem:
  config.gem "timcharper-calendar_date_select", :version => "1.11", :source => "http://gems.github.com", :lib => 'gem_init'

Install the gem locally (this installs the gem system wide)
	sudo rake gems:install
	
Unpack the gem locally (this unpacks it vendor/gems/ inside your applicatio)
	rake gems:unpack

Remove the system wide gem (this is require until Ticket#324 is closed [http://rails.lighthouseapp.com/projects/8994/tickets/324-gem-dependencies-inconsistently-load-rails-init-rb])
	sudo gem uninstall artmotion-calendar_date_select

Don't forget to include the javascript helper in your view:
	<%= javascript_include_tag :defaults %>  
	<%= calendar_date_select_includes %>

commit.message: bumped to version 1.11
Merge commit 'lightningdb/master'
Applied fix outlined in Issue #83: http://code.google.com/p/calendardateselect/issues/detail?id=83
credited artmotion
next version will be 1.11
Merge branch 'release'
Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/artmotion/calendar_date_select
increased version to 1.10.7
Added gem_init for vendored gem installation. Updated README to reflect the installation
Added French localization.  Thanks, herve.nivon!
Added date_format euro_24hr_yyyymmdd
Changed gem version to 1.10.6
cange version to 1.10.5
corrected typo in gemspec
added gemspec file try #1
added Portuguese translation (thanks,  Bruno Andrade Alves!)

Fix to correct positioning of calendar_date_select within a scrollable div. (Thanks, Mikel Lindsaar!)

...
The problem is that if you have a calender_date_select tag within a
scrollable div.  The offset gets calculated from the divs initial
position, so if you scroll the div up, then click, your date select
picker ends up three or four screens down the page.

Luckily, the fix is insanely easy.

Just change 'cumulativeOffset' in the positionCalendarDiv with 'viewportOffset'.

name: mephisto_xmlrpc
description: XML-RPC plugin   for  Mephisto ( works with all desktop blogging tools)
readme:
= MephistoXmlrpc


== Configuration
 install the plugin using script/pugin

follow these steps

1:  edit file app/controllers/application/error.rb

locate these lines 

rescue_from ActiveRecord::RecordNotFound,        :with => :render_admin_not_found
rescue_from ActionController::UnknownController, :with => :render_admin_not_found
rescue_from ActionController::UnknownAction,     :with => :render_admin_not_found

change these lines to

rescue_from ::ActiveRecord::RecordNotFound,        :with => :render_admin_not_found
rescue_from ::ActionController::UnknownController, :with => :render_admin_not_found
rescue_from ::ActionController::UnknownAction,     :with => :render_admin_not_found

save the file .

2:  checkout action web service from svn repo. into vendor/rails folder.     

svn co    http://svn.rubyonrails.org/rails/ousted/actionwebservice/

3.  restart your server 

Now you have working xmlrpc service at your server .

==BUGS

Please report all bugs and/or submit patches to: jeet at railshacks dot com

name: conspire
description: A real-time collaborative editing platform built on Git.
readme:
= conspire

(c) 2008 Phil Hagelberg
http://github.com/technomancy/conspire

Conspire is a real-time collaborative editing platform using Git as a
transport layer.

== Installation

You'll need git 1.5.5 or higher. Ubuntu 8.04 has an older git, but
MacPorts' version is OK. You'll also need the package
libavahi-compat-libdnssd-dev on Debian-based systems.

  $ sudo gem install roastbeef; roastbeef install git
  $ sudo apt-get install libavahi-compat-libdnssd-dev

Once prerequisites are met:

  $ sudo gem install technomancy-conspire --source=http://gems.github.com

== Usage

Conspiracy sessions operate around repositories rather than single
files like other collaborative editors. See lib/conspire/support to
see which editors are supported. In Emacs, first install conspire.el,
then visit the file you want to edit and invoke M-x conspire-mode.

Repository history is cleared in between conspiracy sessions.

You can manually use conspire if you want to try it out without an
editor. Just launch +conspire+ with a directory as its only argument,
and it will initialize a new git repository in there and launch a
conspiracy session. You will have to manually "git add" new files you
want to introduce to the session.

For testing purposes, you can run two or more conspiracies on the same
machine; you just have to specify an alternate port and name for the
others. Names should always include the string "conspiracy" to
distinguish them from other gitjour repositories.

  $ conspire repo -p 7457 -n conspiracy2

Set the DEBUG environment variable to get more information on the console.

== Bugs

* Conflict resolution remains entirely unhandled.

* Emacs is the only supported editor; see below.

* When using Avahi for your ZeroConf implementation, you will not be
  able to do anything unless you have an active network connection. So
  disconnected conspirancy sessions are not possible without bringing
  up an ad-hoc network to trick Avahi into activating. You'll also see
  a big fat warning, which should be ignored.

== Contributing

Patches are welcome via github or email. Adding support for more
editors would probably be the most useful contributions, though
anything is appreciated.

Editors must support:

* Saving on an interval
* Committing files to the repo
* Refreshing internal buffers

Edits should not be allowed in between these steps. Editors may be
able to support launching the +conspire+ executable for added
convenience.

comments.body: This commit was caused by running conspire-mode in an Emacs instance that was also editing the conspire.el source. I wonder if this is the first time a piece of software has ever committed to itself.
